page.title: 04ST PETER'S CHURCH, DEVIZES
page.content: St Peter's Church is next to St Peter's School, Bath Road in Devizes. It was built in 1866, and made of stone with the roof made of tiles. Inside the church there are three large pillars. There are some statues, one of Mary holding her son Jesus and another of St Peter. In his left hand he holds two keys, one is gold, which stands for Heaven, and the other is lead, which stands for hell. There are statues depicting the crucifixion on the rood screen. Jesus is on the cross, and on one side there is John and on the other is Mary. There are seven windows with out any stained glass in them. The west window has the most interesting image because it has one angel on each side of Jesus. One of the angels has a shield. Above it is a sword which is on the left hand side of Jesus.
